Wandb version is 0.9.4. Here's the minimal code to get the error: <denchmark-code>from unittest.mock import MagicMock import wandb def test_minimal(): wandb.run = MagicMock() wandb_logger = pl.loggers.WandbLogger(project='num2vec') trainer = pl.Trainer(max_epochs=1, gpus=[1], logger=wandb_logger) dataset = preprocess.WikiNumDataset(task='read', sample=100, multi=False, max_len=30, num_tok='binning') net = read.Reader(transformers.BertModel.from_pretrained('bert-base-uncased'), enc='value', units=dataset.units, num_vocab_size=dataset.num_bins) train_loader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(dataset, batch_size=4) trainer.fit(net, train_loader, val_dataloaders=[train_loader]) </denchmark-code>
The same works when I do this outside of pytest.

It's so odd this isn't working. One thing to try would be to set wandb_logger._experiment = MagicMock() in your test_minimal. The other option is to install our next generation client with pip install wandb -U --pre and set os.environ["WANDB_MODE"] = "noop" in your test.

set wandb_logger._experiment = MagicMock() in your test_minimal
This worked, thanks!
